title: Excellent app!! Problem was fixedüôèüèª
text: Had an account with Instagram for 3-4 years plus and logged on today for it to say account disabled for going against community guidelines but won‚Äôt show me what it was that I went against, and also doesn‚Äôt give me the option to log back in when I try, it just loads a black screen and continues to try and load nothing. Can‚Äôt forget about when I was trying to get help with my account issue I‚Äôm having, but theirs no email or phone number you can contact about for any customer support which is outrageous for a platform who‚Äôs supposed to meet supply and demand and actually help their customers who use their services. Will definitely change my review and rating if the situation is addressed and can get the help to get my account back but at the moment would rate 0 stars if possible if I wasn‚Äôt needed to leave at-least one on this review. Updated my Instagram and account is now back up and working don‚Äôt know if it was just a technical error and glitch from the app itself prompting that message but my account is back up and working so thank you Instagram!!!

title: Instagram is a bully
text:
They will delete your account without any warning and it doesn‚Äôt matter if your content is good or bad. They don‚Äôt care how their users feel about the new algorithm updates. Don‚Äôt bother trying to make a complaint, no one will respond. Your content gets restricted or shadow banned depending on what you post or what hashtags you use. If you‚Äôre a conservative, don‚Äôt bother using this bias platform to voice your opinions, they will shut you down. You‚Äôll see the same 20 people on your timeline regardless of how many 1000s you follow. Advertising is everywhere and can‚Äôt be avoided! Don‚Äôt post often? Consider your account deleted for not using it. The new algorithm makes you interact more with followers so that your content is seen but yet my likes continue to drop and more of my longtime followers have unfollowed me. When I message them to ask why they all said they didn‚Äôt unfollow me and thought I did. So not only does Instagram restrict accounts they don‚Äôt like or consider popular but will also remove some of your most active followers to keep your content from being seen. They act as if they are too good to be true but are really setting themselves up to less than MySpace in a few years.

I really suggest switching to Vero The True Social App! Been there a few months and I love it. Plus, they aren‚Äôt as strict as Instagram and you see content from all the people you follow.

title: instagram editors
text:
i‚Äôm sure instagram knows by now that a lot of people use their platform to share edits. there‚Äôs lots of editing accounts on instagram (i have 3). but as editors, we have lots of problems with your app. i‚Äôll start with the biggest one, the percentage thing. where it says ‚Äúthis post is doing 80% better than your other posts.‚Äù since editors have gotten the instagram update, our views/likes have gone wayyyy down. and we believe it‚Äôs something to do with the rule that only a small percentage of our followers can see our posts. that is just so unfair. we spend hours/days at a time working on edits. they‚Äôre not easy to make. but we do it because we love to edit & we want to make our followers happy. editors work their butts off and deserve more than 5% or 7% of their followers to see them. problem 2. instagram quality. when we export our edits they‚Äôre in good quality. but when we post them the quality just goes down? that‚Äôs a huge letdown when you spend hours on an edit, just to post it and it has bad quality. problem 3. only 5 accounts? if anything there should be unlimited accounts. other editors & i probably want to create more than 5 accounts, because we like to edit more than 5 people! instagram, your app used to be a very good platform for editors, but you honestly need to fix your stuff. 
-L

title: Honestly this is getting annoying
text: You guys need to start listening to your users. Everything on here is just so messed up, the whole algorithm thing is annoying, and the feed/comments should be in chronological order. I don‚Äôt want to see someone‚Äôs post from two weeks ago I want to see the posts that were posted an hour or two ago. Also it isn‚Äôt fair that only certain story stickers are available to everyone. Yes I get that when you release things to the public it take time for everyone to get it so that‚Äôs understandable but when only some stickers are released to certain people that‚Äôs when it becomes unfair. I want to be able to add links to my stories but I can‚Äôt because it‚Äôs not released to everyone or not everyone has gotten the update yet. Also some lgbtq+ post have been taken down and honestly that‚Äôs just not right what is so wrong with lgbtq+ is it effecting anyone personally? No, no it‚Äôs not. Also being a depression help account on instagram I find it really rude that you take down posts that talk about depression/anxiety/self harm, then give people lousy websites that that so called ‚Äòhelp people‚Äô with that stuff. Just leave the posts up so someone can hopefully find the post and give/get the person that posted it needed help that will actually help them. Instagram please just start listening to your users or Instagram is just going to become as dead as Facebook.

title: Some issues
text: While I enjoy this app, I've been using it for 3 years, there are some recent issues that have been bothering me. All the updates have just been going downhill since the chronological order of your feed was removed. My feed is a mess of the same people over and over again with posts from many days ago because instagram thinks I want to see that stuff above everything else. The "solution" was to help you stay up to date with the posts you miss, but now I am missing more posts in my feed than before because of this system. I recommend making it an option in settings to turn on chronological order of your feed, it would make things so much easier. Another issue I have is that I recently noticed that the accounts you follow are no longer in chronological order either? There seems to be no organized way they are put in order, it's just like it was randomly thrown in there like that. This proves to be very difficult for me to find accounts I have recently followed as they no longer show up at the top of my followed box. I am following over 1,600 accounts so I have a very hard time remembering the name of an account I just followed. I just wanted to find one account and now it's lost in the many accounts I follow. Please make these changes, it would make the app so much easier to use.

title: poor algorithm
text: I have both a personal and a business account with instagram, neither of which I am very impressed with; my personal account is constantly spammed by follow requests from what clearly are not real accounts, and my business account has an even worse reach than my PRIVATE personal account. There really is no point in choosing a business account unless you are willing to spend money on the promotion features. It does you no good otherwise. Even worse than how badly my posts perform on this platform compared to others like Tiktok, it is difficult to find relevant content in the home page feed and the discover page. My home page is plagued by posts that are mis-hashtagged, and the discover page is often a cesspool of content I have never interacted with. I will also be shown posts that I have already seen multiple times. Not to mention how difficult it is to find anything by searching for it; unless you select a hashtag, there is no way to filter the results by popular, recent, etc. Much of the time, searching key words will only produce a page full of users whose names contain the terms, even if you do not select the ‚Äòpeople‚Äô section to search specifically. The biggest detriment is easily this algorithm and the added problem of not being able to find anything outside of the algorithm‚Äôs selections.

title: It‚Äôs only gotten worse.
text: I have had Instagram since 2016. I hate to admit that it has only progressively gotten worse. Between the lack of attention the company puts in to what people are posting, to a few irritating things that come along with it, I unfortunately would not recommend anymore. For example, many times that I open my phone, I see sexual explicit content that would be available to ANYONE on the app. I understand that it may be certain accounts that you follow, but in my opinion that should not matter. As an adult, the only issue is that it can be uncomfortable to open the app in public. On the other hand, kids opening the app at places such as school could get in trouble for such content being present on their screen, EVEN THOUGH they had absolutely no intention of something like that being the first thing they see when they open this app. Another irritating component is scrolling through my feed daily and seeing posts from WEEKS ago that I have already watched, liked, etc. Also, somehow I follow these random/spam accounts that I know, for a fact, I did not follow. Very frustrating. I don‚Äôt use facebook or twitter or anything like that, so I am not sure what those medias are like, but what I do know is that I used to love instagram and just can‚Äôt say I even like it anymore. Instagram, please make adjustments.

title: Don‚Äôt feel bad for these owners
text: These restaurant and bar owners pay the waiters and waitresses $2.40 an hour and their bartenders $5.25 an hour, the owners say they don‚Äôt have to pay minimum wage bc they get tips, a couple of years ago the owners started taking the servers credit card tips and placing them on the servers check, which means the tips r taxed on the paychecks, the servers r only allowed to bring cash tips home the night they work, we live in Myrtle Beach, SC, but this goes on in many places, so basically the owners don‚Äôt pay the servers anything, the servers just work for cash tips and the owners don‚Äôt pay anything, don‚Äôt feel bad for those owners that have been ripping off their employees for years, please research this and u will see how right I‚Äôam , and no benefits either for the servers, even have to pay for their own meals, if your lucky u might get 50% off certain items, would u work for $2.00 bucks an hour, and these r just not the small businesses, it‚Äôs also the Hilton, the Marriott, and others, feel bad for us, the workers, not the owners whom have taken advantage of the workers way before the Pandemic ever happened, thank u!

title: Does nothing to resolve hate and violence
text: I have been threatened and harassed multiple times and every time I report it, it either magically doesn‚Äôt violate their policies or there isn‚Äôt anyone to assist me. But when I talk about ethnic cleansing, genocide, and apartheid‚Äî-issues that are very pressing and very much taking place currently‚Äî-they apparently violate their FB/IG policies. This type of oppression and censorship is not only morally wrong but also a violation of the constitution. We‚Äôve seen Zuckerberg summoned multiple times for the amount of influence he possesses through these apps. But with that kind of influence comes responsibilities. These two apps have contributed to not only sprees of violet on public and private scales but also are one of the leading causes for ignorance and misinformation. Giving it a 1 star for not just all of things I‚Äôve mentioned, but also because they glitch often and are have now become some kind of aliexpress. Listen if I want to old furniture from some sketchy person in my area or buy dresses from China, I‚Äôll go directly to those websites. Why my timeline and newsfeed is littered with everything but my friends and family is beyond me. This is why the younger generation doesn‚Äôt want anything to do with these apps. The difference between Mark and Tom from MySpace is that, Tom doesn‚Äôt have blood on his hands and we (the millennials) actually respect him.

title: Accept and stop chatting
text:
I love Instagram and it helps me explore and find new things and communities but I don‚Äôt like that if someone follows me and if I follow back, they can automatically start a chat with me. With out giving me the option to click accept or decline. It‚Äôs bother some following a page I like but then the person starts to spam my messages without having me ‚ÄúAccept‚Äù them. On that note: I would love a ‚Äústop chatting‚Äù option. I accidentally clicked the accept button when cleaning my screen for someone and they keep messaging me non stop even after I told them I wish to no longer chat with them, and after I explained that I accepted them by mistake, they keep chatting with me. I don‚Äôt like how I have asked many people and they all told me that my only option is to block the person. I find that extreme to block someone over me accidentally clicking ‚ÄúAccept‚Äù. 

I would love those two things: 
‚Ä¢No automatic ‚ÄúAccept‚Äù to chats when both people follow each other 
‚Ä¢A ‚Äústop chatting‚Äù button so you can stop talking to people and you‚Äôll have to Accept or Decline them all over again. (It‚Äôll be great if it kept the chats also just in case of anything)

title: Main Feed Now Cluttered
text:
Hello! As an artist, Instagram has been a great way of reaching out as a creative to other creatives, and see a regular stream of artist‚Äôs content on my feed.

Unfortunately, with each update, I‚Äôve been having a harder and harder time both reaching out and seeing other people‚Äôs posts. Especially with the latest one ‚Äî now, my main feed cuts off at all unread posts, and gives me a curated stream of recommended posts, which isn‚Äôt what I look for on my main feed. I‚Äôm looking for the people I actually follow and want to see content of, even if it‚Äôs old content! Old posts are now on a separate page that I can only find if I reach the end of my unread feed, and they‚Äôre not even sorted by time posted. Popularity-based algorithms that try to predict what I want to see inevitably make it harder for small creatives to reach out to their communities, and only make viewers have even easier access to accounts that already are popular.

I greatly enjoy using Instagram, as a creative and as a user, because of the easy access to a feed of other artists that I am already following ‚Äî I don‚Äôt have this easy access anymore. If I‚Äôm going to look for other accounts, I would rather it be on a different tab, not shoved in my face while I‚Äôm on my main feed.

title: Not banned but can‚Äôt login- No one at IG seems to care
text: One day Instagram randomly logged me out of my account. I tried to log back in and all I get is ‚Äú sorry there is a problem with your request‚Äù. It has been like that for over a week. My account is not banned because I can log in on other peoples phones and I can even log in on my own phone under the google chrome browser. It‚Äôs clearly a problem with the app. I even had my brother try to login to his account on my app and it won‚Äôt even let him in and there is nothing wrong with his account. I have tried redownloading the app, turning my phone on and off, and even resetting my whole phone and nothing has helped. I have reached out to Instagram for help and no has responded and based on things I‚Äôve read they never will. The lack of tech support for one of the biggest apps on the market is incredibly stupid. I have done research and there is several hundreds if not thousands of people dealing with this same issue and have been for years and are still stuck and Instagram refuses to look into it or respond to anyone and help them. It‚Äôs disgusting. I have come to the conclusion I will never be able to use this app again until Instagram decides to join the 21st century and actually have a tech support team where you can actually talk to someone about your app problems. It‚Äôs 2020, I cannot believe I have to deal with this.

title: Not user friendly!!! üò°
text: This is a fun app until you start actually having lots of friends/followers and Instagram blocks you from being able to do anything because you comment/type/read too fast. Or maybe it‚Äôs because you tag too many people or who really knows the reason why because Instagram is absolutely unclear on their rules and they don‚Äôt ever respond when you try to contact them through ‚Äúhelp‚Äù.  I get that they have a problem with spam and bots, but that is their problem and they should find a better way of dealing with it other than blocking real people just trying to communicate with real followers/friends!  They could for instance, give a warning before actually blocking or perhaps put some type of timer or ‚Äúspeedometer‚Äù in the message box if they don‚Äôt want to allow users to type fast for some unknown reason.  They could have a way to prove that you‚Äôre a live person and go ahead and unblock you rather than just keeping you in instajail for days with no explanation.  It seems to me that in trying to block bots/spam they have become super user unfriendly!! Come on Instagram, get innovative and do better!!!

title: It‚Äôs not worth bothering anymore
text: I‚Äôve had Instagram for over three years, and as time has moved on, the app got worse, I run an account that used to get over 100,000 views per post, but now that they changed the algorithms to benefit only advertisers (a very sneaky and Miley hungry move, like Facebook does) my posts will rarely get more than 5,000 views. Hundreds of other accounts and I work to make our posts show up on the explore page and build a community, but now all you can find on the explored page are irrelevant posts and ads. Also, I‚Äôm pretty sure everyone on Instagram had been begging for a chronological feed as long as Instagram has existed. Well we got an update to our feeds, but definitely not what we were hoping for. The December 27th update where you swipe sideways like a story to see your feed may have just ruined Instagram. It is so inconvenient to access the explore page, switch accounts, go to your profile, and post on your story. You can‚Äôt tap or swipe to switch stories without accidentally pulling up random stats you really don‚Äôt need to see, and it‚Äôs very difficult to do one handed, which is one of the things that made Instagram so easy and accessible. I know this update is taking me off Instagram, and I‚Äôm sure I‚Äôm not the only one leaving for good. Please Instagram, actually listen to your users when making an update and don‚Äôt pretend this is what we want.

title: Instagrams identity crisis and new updates are ruining the app
text: I have a small art account on Instagram and all of the new Instagram updates have made it so hard for people to reach content. I work extremely hard on not just on my art but also my videos and posts, all just so that not even my followers see it. If what you‚Äôre posting isn‚Äôt a reel, Instagram just does not show it. Even some reels will still not be shown on peoples feeds. I know many way larger art creators and businesses that have the same problem. These updates have caused it to go so downhill. Posts are not receiving any attention at all (even from followers!) and only certain reels are. To make matters worse along-side this Instagram does not take reports seriously. I have had multiple instances where I have reported comments for hate, bullying, and homophobic remarks yet Instagram has not done anything about any of them, just sent the reports back as fine despite the fact that they clearly are not.  It used to be a great place and now it‚Äôs just not nearly as good. I still love and will keep Instagram, though I am hoping that they resolve this and go back to their old and better ways. They are trying to be like other apps instead of themselves and it is crushing accounts like mine and causing instagrams downfall.

title: Broken
text: Instagram has been completely messed up for me the past few days. The biggest problem is, every time I click on a notification (from within the app or from a push notification) it only opens the comment section on that post, not the actual post. So I will click on the notification, it shows me a bunch of comments, but there‚Äôs no way to see the post itself; I‚Äôll forget what the notification is and never end up seeing the post. Even clicking on my own post from notifications if someone likes it does the same thing. Another thing is I keep getting notifications from the same post, sometimes hours later. Also, another horrible problem is if somebody sends me a post from a private account that I don‚Äôt follow, and then I start following that account, even after I get approved it still says in the dms ‚Äúthis is a private account follow them to see this message‚Äù so I don‚Äôt know what post was sent to me. Gets super annoying. Lastly, this one isn‚Äôt a huge deal but it still a weird glitch: sometimes when I open a video somebody sent in dms (from camera roll, not a post) the sound from that will keep playing on Instagram. Leaving the app and coming back doesn‚Äôt stop it, the only thing that stops it is closing the app in multitasking. Hope you guys are working on these issues, thanks

title: Application Needs to Be Fixed
text: So many problems Insights Not Showing up under professional dashboard or working for professional accounts like mine. Monetization Policy Violations for every post ‚Ä¶ how is the possible??? No one is happy with Instagram policies & constant violations for posts & reels NOT IN VIOLATION. Zero community violations so why are we all having issues. It‚Äôs all over the Blogs & Reddit how Instagram is horrible about it & how their so called help is of no help. Instagram AI (auto answers) not given any helpful advice and definitely not individual help from an actual person. It‚Äôs awful. Absolutely need the AI fixed. Worst service. It‚Äôs a mediocre app that seems to just want our money and do not care about the professionals on it. It‚Äôs been a mess since Facebook took it over. Fix the issues so we can run out businesses effectively. Monetizing for professionals should be options - some programs are not needed to be used for some businesses. I can‚Äôt get help with setting up my merchandise shop. I‚Äôm not interested in monetizing from a reel or post. That doesn‚Äôt help my business. Music feature also isn‚Äôt working.  It‚Äôs not fixing any problems/bugs.  Also where are the notes section?  Some have it and some don‚Äôt. Meta has made it more confusing. It awful. Do better instagram.

title: Why I‚Äôm leaving Insta
text:
I have been an avid instagram user since I was 13, now I‚Äôm in my early twenties and everything about Meta‚Äôs platforms disgusts me. Starting  January 1st 2023 I will not longer be on Instagram and I suggest you do the same. From the blatant withholding of knowledge that the company has had on the mental health impacts on its users; to the stealing of features from other competitors. Instagram has lost its touch with its user base, and with the introduction of reels, their video scrolling format that they blatantly took from the success of TikTok (which is also devastating to your mental health) it has pushed me to this decision. Video scrolling is too addicting and not what instagram is; until there is a way to disable reels I will not even consider coming back to this platform. 

If anyone with Meta or now formerly employed with Meta after the large layoffs, reads this understand this. When your CEO only apologizes to you when you lose your job in a bad economic downturn because of poor investments he made without any input from the workers; that‚Äôs a terrible person and a terrible company. Do not put your time energy and effort into a company that will steal your value and in turn slowly tear at the fabric of our society with its algorithm.

title: Last Year I would have voted 5 Stars
text:
Instagram is the greatest photo sharing platform out there, but with that being said; I still have some issues with it as it stands. I run an Amateur Toy Photography account and I‚Äôve noticed some negative changes in the algorithm that seem to be negatively impacting my Instagram reach.

Despite gaining new followers, despite posting regular/relevant content, despite having a ton of ‚Äúnew connections‚Äù, and despite having ‚Äúincreased reach‚Äù according to Instagram standards, the amount of likes that I‚Äôve been receiving along with the amount of people who see my posts has drastically declined. I also haven‚Äôt shown up in the Explore Page or hashtag pages in many months even though my posts have been receiving more likes than the average post on said hashtag pages. 

I would just sell this off as ‚Äúmy posts just aren‚Äôt that popular‚Äù, but I don‚Äôt think that‚Äôs true because at one point they were. The quality and frequency of my posts haven‚Äôt declined, but my momentum and reach have. I blame the underperformance of my posts on not appearing in popular hash tag pages related to my content. I really hope that Instagram fixes the algorithm and returns it to where it was about a year or two ago because whatever is going on now appears to be nerfing my reach.

title: Ban Instagram and Their Unconstitutional Policy
text: Your infringement on free speech should be criminal (if it isn‚Äôt a chargeable offense already). Deleting this review would most definitely be criminal. Not only did you delete my account I‚Äôve had since I was 12 (now 23) which is pretty damaging to me and my social reputation, my new one was banned for expressing my opinion. I want my old one, but my multiple appeals have yet to be looked at and this happened well over 4 months ago. I posted this exactly, ‚ÄúYea he did get off. These people need to learn a lesson. Whether they are mentally deranged, on drugs or legitimately trying to hurt you, they disturb the peace of people at the very minimum which carries consequences of varying severity.‚Äù This was in reference to a guy wearing a clown costume in the dead of the night standing in the middle of the road. A guy stopped his car and asked if he was okay, the clown proceeded with no response to bolt towards the car, of which the drive responded to with pulling out a gun. Without a doubt, this company cares 0% about you or the people of the USA. Not to mention the way they exploit young children with targeted exposure to specific topics is disgusting. In conclusion, these tech companies need to be boycotted and stocks liquidated. They infringe on the right of everyday Americans, exploit our children, and damage relationships. How far will we let them push us?

title: my thoughts
text:
I have a lot of things to say so basically Instagram is a great app and everything because they are the reasons why I have my friends fight now because I haven‚Äôt had friends before even I found out about Instagram I was chilling on Instagram a lot but yes Instagram is a great app but the point that annoys me is when they ban my accounts for no reason when I just wanna be on the app and I am innocent anywaysü§∑‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è so they are just banning accounts when it‚Äôs not js me its another people who have another accounts and its very sad because people work hard on there accounts all their messages and everything that they lose their storys instagram just needs to let people keep their accounts they can‚Äôt just ban people that fast I can‚Äôt control them but the thing is there‚Äôs no reason too? but there‚Äôs a lot of things to not like about instagram because I remember one time which it happen last year 2022 there was an glitch and I wasn‚Äôt able to text all of my friends for a while and I was super upset ab it they just very need to fix their app because this is gonna keep happening all the time we have the app for a reason? . sorry Instagram but you need to work more on your app . 

insta pls update notes for me

title: No customer support
text: I‚Äôve used Instagram for years and always loved it. A little while ago my entire account was deleted for ‚Äúgoing against guidelines on facebook.‚Äù Apparently my facebook and Instagram had been linked (I didn‚Äôt know this) and my Facebook account had been hacked. Whatever was being posted or sent by the hacker ended up getting my facebook account taken down and since it was linked to my Instagram, that was also deleted. I was devastated as I had priceless memories shared on my Instagram page that I knew I could not get back, along with that account following a few friends that have passed away which I now cannot see as their accounts are private. I tried contacting customer support but there was no option. I tried appealing the ban that I had on my account and all that came back was a message saying that it is permanently disabled due to whatever had happened on my facebook. I was never able to speak to anyone on the Instagram team about regaining access to my account, and ended up having to make a whole new account. All I really wanted was to have those old memories back and be able to speak with someone from IG about getting my account back. Moral of the story, don‚Äôt link your Facebook and Instagram accounts, and make sure you have everything saved to your device or you could lose it all.

title: Updates? No. Stop making unnecessary ‚Äúimprovements.‚Äù
text: For starters, I don‚Äôt want ‚Äúinstagram - from the company that sold your data to Russians in an attempt to win the 2016 presidential election‚Äù (Muller report concluded this; So did Ocasio-Cortez‚Äôs questioning of Zuckerberg). Considering Instagrams heavy youth use, and the prevalence of being against corruption, this distance would be an obvious marketing point. I think one of the main reasons people use Instagram is because they prefer that diversity between apps; even though it‚Äôs owned by Facebook. Not to mention the fact that now, the DM‚Äôs look scarily similar to messenger. I have to ask exactly why? Users prefer differences between their apps. If they wanted a messenger-like experience, they‚Äôd get messenger. I‚Äôd greatly appreciate the app to not lose a significant amount of user support. Also, the algorithm has consistently failed us. If you could address and correct these problems before they become even more of an issue, that would be great. Facebook to most Instagram users, it leads a feeling of uncertainty and mistrust. Our data was sold to a foreign nation. That‚Äôs unacceptable. So saying ‚ÄúInstagram- from Facebook‚Äù while making substantial changes to the app; it‚Äôs quite concerning. The app was amazing before. Now? No. Not at all. If this wouldn‚Äôt have happened, you‚Äôd have five stars. Zuckerberg has destroyed facebooks reputation. It‚Äôs not too late for Instagram... yet.

title: fix yourselves
text:
I‚Äôm not usually one to write reviews. However, today I am. I, my two sisters and my father all have Instagram. I have had it the longest. My two sisters recently got it and within a month BOTH of them have been hacked. One just moments ago. The other was logged out while she was on the app and was never able to get back in. She was forced to create an old account and has to tell people almost DAILY that she was hacked and to please unfollow the old account because the hacked is now messaging her followers. The sister that was just hacked today has sent out links saying ‚Äúshe made this for them‚Äù. I go to report my sisters accounts for being hacked for their safety and that option isn‚Äôt given. At this point I‚Äôm scared for not only my sisters safety but also my father AND myself. Instagram do better. Instead of rearranging your app appearance and trying to make your app look like other successful platforms, maybe you should focus on your app‚Äôs security for your users. This is honestly just proving your parent company‚Äôs scandal to be more truthful than you are letting on. 
Sincerely,
Disappointed üôÅ

title: Missing ‚Äúsee translation‚Äù button
text:
I can‚Äôt translate posts in a different language after this new update... which is annoying because how can I understand posts of friends in different countries who don‚Äôt speak the same language as me? I cant copy and paste the caption into google translate so there‚Äôs no way to understand what they‚Äôre saying. Please fix this, thanks.
Also, literally everyone wants you to switch back to chronological posts. Why don‚Äôt you listen to your users? The algorithms are so dumb, I‚Äôve stopped seeing posts for some of my favorite accounts lately just because the algorithm doesn‚Äôt think I‚Äôll like them. I‚Äôll go find the account with posts that don‚Äôt show up in my feed and purposefully like and comment on all of their recent pictures, but still some posts from my favorite accounts don‚Äôt ever show up in my feed even if they post ALL the time. If I want to make sure I don‚Äôt miss certain posts then I turn on post notifications. But this algorithm is hella annoying and I miss when Instagram had the chronological feed. I know most everyone agrees with me, I mean cmon Instagram, it‚Äôs painfully obvious. At some point some other social media app is going to come along and you‚Äôll be as irrelevant as Facebook. So why not try to please your users as best as you can instead of more and more people taking a break from insta??? Just asking the real questions here

title: No customer service and countless deleted accounts
text: I have had over 5 different accounts that I have lost to Instagram from Instagram randomly logging me out from my accounts and then not letting me log back in due to an error in the app. It says something along the lines of ‚Äúplease wait a while and try again later‚Äù no matter how long I wait it gives me that message. Now you may think to reach out to customer service after this happens right? WELL THERE IS NO CUSTOMER SERVICE. There‚Äôs no one to call, no one to email. There‚Äôs not even a robot to speak to online. It baffles me that this has happened to me so many times for years now and still I can‚Äôt find a solution to this other than creating a new account and starting all over again. I‚Äôve had an account get hacked and then never regain access to it because there‚Äôs no one to help me. You‚Äôd think with the billions of dollars that Instagram and Facebook raise that there would be someone to help you but no. Not a single soul. Go ahead and use Instagram, and when you inevitably run into the same issue I run into consistently for the last 9 years  then you can enjoy the pleasure of having to throw away the account that you‚Äôve been building for however long, because Instagram is too busy making money and not putting any of it back into the company to improve itself

title: Instagram helped make my career
text: I don‚Äôt know where this review is going to And who‚Äôs going to be reading it but it said if I wanted to write a review and I never write a review for anything. But I must say Instagram Revolutionized my life. Obviously it was me that did most of the work but the networking which clearly be significantly different if it wasn‚Äôt for social media platform like Instagram. I do tattoos for a living and all of my clientele comes from people who email me after seeing my page of Instagram . People from all mover the world get to see my work and know who I am . Instagram came out when I started tattooing and what a blessing that was .I've been able to network with other artists and announce to public when I‚Äôd be in different states doing a guest appearance at other shops . It‚Äôs important not to get obsessed with your like and followers but they should also keep you motivated to keep leveling up in whatever your presenting on Instagram .  But anyway I just wanted to say a few years ago I decided to turn everything around in my life and when it came to getting into the tattoo industry Instagram had a huge impact on how I network my craft .

title: You need to fix this
text: I‚Äôve had Instagram ever since I was in middle school and used it all the time! Now I‚Äôm barely on it. My issues are for one the algorithm I feel like people tell you this all the time and you have yet to change it. It‚Äôs annoying how I‚Äôm always seeing the same people post & sometimes I‚Äôll miss my friends post and end up seeing it like 3 days later like what sense does that make ? I thought Instagram was a way to connect with friends and see what they post and it‚Äôs like now I can‚Äôt even do that cause I barely see their post!!! My second problem is anytime I‚Äôm looking through comments it scrolls down by itself and I have to scroll all the way back up to what I was reading. Can y‚Äôall fix that cause it‚Äôs absolutely annoying can‚Äôt even finish reading a comment. Another problem I have is the shopping part of Instagram. I know for a fact I am not hitting that button EVER to shop it‚Äôs a useless button and stop popping up in my notifications about the shop stuff and lastly the reels get rid of it plain and simple that‚Äôs why there‚Äôs tiktok and I‚Äôm not using reels like I‚Äôm using tiktok. Instagram is a photo sharing app once you guys realize that again I think people will love it just like they did when they first Dowloaded it. Now you trying to be like all these other apps mixed in one and it‚Äôs annoying

title: Love the app but way too many bugs now
text: Usually I love this app however ever since the few recent updates there are so many bugs. I don't mind the new layout changes as I can adapt, but as far as the bugs on this app - that I don't enjoy. Everytime I like a photo/post, it automatically unlikes immediately after (I have to retap the post a couple more times which can be annoying). The biggest issue for me now is I just got a brand new iPhone 12 Pro Max and the app completely refuses to show me push notifications. I've updated the phone settings multiple times and even changed the push notification settings within the Instagram app itself. No matter what I do, notifications just won't work. It's very annoying especially because this is a new phone and the previous issue I stated earlier (automatically unliking posts as soon as I tap the heart icon) persists on my brand new iPhone. Videos also pause about 5 seconds in, almost everytime I'm viewing a video it freezes. Looks like these problems are shared among many people as well, you'd think Instagram would fix it by now. Like I said I do enjoy this app and it allows me to do many things, but recently the app has just been so buggy it's unfortunate. I hope it gets resolved soon!

title: Good when it‚Äôs working.
text: Although I love Instagram when it works, it‚Äôs annoying when they reset the explore page and flush all your custom ‚Äúfor you‚Äù feed to random photography that I couldn‚Äôt care less about. I mainly go on Instagram to look at my explore page feed when I‚Äôm bored, but when it resets I can‚Äôt do that. Another problem is that Instagram has logged me out of multiple accounts for no reason, causing me to have to start a new account and lose everything on my other accounts. I know this is instagrams fault as I have never given my password to anyone (online or real life) therefore, couldn‚Äôt have been hacked. I‚Äôve also recently been ‚Äúbanned‚Äù from liking posts for two days, which dosent make sense because the pop up said that it was do to ‚Äúmy previous use of the feature.‚Äù I like completely normal content and had no reason to banned. I know I‚Äôm not the only one experiencing problems either, Instagram always shuts down and doesn‚Äôt load, and not because of WiFi, everyone on the app complained at one point and it became a thing where everyone flooded to twitter. They to fix their issues because I‚Äôm getting tired of having problems with the app. Other than these reoccurring inconveniences, I like the app when it‚Äôs working.

title: Temporarily Banned
text: I frequently find my account temporarily banned from liking posts or adding captions to my own. I have sought to find a solution to my problem, however, the only advice I can find is to stop the usage of any services that assist in boosting likes and/or followers. Had I been using any such service I would have complied, but I never registered my account to such a site. I understand bots and the like are a reoccurring issue, and the Insta team is trying their best, but this issue happens too frequently to a person who has done no wrong. As a person who averages less than 50 likes per post and has only gained 150 followers (total) in a year, I can assure you that I am not using a service to boost my exposure. Temp. Bans happen incredibly often, sometimes twice a month, for my account. Each time I had done nothing to raise suspicion. I do not look forward to my next week being Temp. Banned, but in the end there‚Äôs nothing I can do but write a review. I hope there aren‚Äôt others experiencing the same problem, but I would appreciate if the matter were solved. Thank you :)

title: Please change the new layout of how you view accounts
text: I have been on Instagram for about 7 years now and I‚Äôve always loved it but please please please listen to your users. My Instagram updates by itself even though my automatic updates are off. I was just on Instagram about 30 minutes ago and it was fine now I go back on and my profile layout is completely different. My profile picture is now on the right side everything is clustered and it is very large, when I go to other peoples accounts it is the same and it is very annoying because it is very hard to navigate this way. Also please stop changing the Algorithm I understand that you guys do it because of advertising purposes but before I can see content from pages that I like I see about 30+ ads and even when I say don‚Äôt show things like this they some how still pop up. Posts from friends or businesses that I am interested in don poo up on my timeline the same day they are posted. A post from three weeks ago will pop on my timeline followed by one from 4 days ago and it is very annoying because I have to turn on post notifications just so that i can see content I am interested in and not jus advertisements. Please fix the layout of the way you view profiles!!

title: New horizontal layout is awful and crashes my iPad Pro 2018
text:
First of all...it‚Äôs 2018 and you still don‚Äôt have a native iPad app, which is frankly awful but now you‚Äôve replaced the most natural gesture of scrolling with a horizontal tap which seems quicker but makes it much harder to scroll back up to thinks you‚Äôve already passed and much harder to keep a sense of chronology (which you also removed) 
Honestly the changes you‚Äôve been making make me not want to use the app anymore, some new features are nice but some are a complete failure. Horizontal scrolling works fine for stories but making stories and posts feel like the same thing is dumb and you still have to scroll vertically when you go to someone‚Äôs grid so why make the app feel even more disjointed?  Now you essentially have four different interfaces, one for ig tv, one for user pages and discover, another for stories and a slightly different one now for the home and they all function differently.

It honestly feels like you haven‚Äôt tested this because across the app people are complaining and also, for users who make posts with multiple images, it‚Äôs a nightmare because you already use horizontal scrolling for that but now you have to be careful not to tap the wrong part or you‚Äôll scroll past the post or be stuck on the post when you intended to do something else. This update is a total mess.

title: I am mad

title: The New Algorithm is Worse
text: I own a photography business and have a business Instagram account which I love as it shows insights and engagement. This tool has helped me tailor and grow my following to close to 2,000 people. However, I had noticed a dramatic reduction in the amount of ‚Äúlikes‚Äù and ‚Äúengagement‚Äù on my posts. Before the new update, I would receive around 300 likes with 1,500 people seeing my post and now I‚Äôm lucky to get 150 ‚Äúlikes‚Äù and 600 people seeing my posts. This is frustrating as it‚Äôs completely stunted my growth as a business and I‚Äôm helpless to do anything about it, even when I post at peak times. One of my peers had mentioned to me that the app now judges the percentage of followers that ‚Äúlike‚Äù your post within the first 10 minutes of you posting to determine how many of your followers will be shown your post. This has hurt me a lot as my posts now don‚Äôt get enough engagement to make it on discover pages or show up at the ‚Äútop‚Äù of locations when I tag them. Not everyone uses Instagram everyday and if your following isn‚Äôt composed of hyperactive users, your posts will get completely pushed aside and buried. Please fix your algorithm so I can continue to grow my business and portfolio. I love Instagram and this app has been a huge benefit to reaching more consumers, please change it back, thank you.

title: Go CHRONOLOGICAL again!
text: The algorithm for posts is terrible. I hate seeing a post of an event or something, but the post was from a few days or a week back, which kinda negates the point of the post sometimes. I liked the chronological order much better... matter of fact, I don‚Äôt know anyone who likes the new algorithm better. However, Instagram refuses to listen to the users, which makes me use the app less and less. Social media platforms are unfortunately becoming more so advertising platforms, which is disappointing. I‚Äôd give IG five stars if there weren‚Äôt so many ads, information collecting/selling, and there was a chronological order of posts again. This app is continually going downhill as it becomes more monetarily driven. It‚Äôs not really for the users anymore. It‚Äôs more of a platform for constant advertisement rather than social media. I still feel the same as above when I wrote this years ago, but wanted to add that the app is and has been consistently getting worse. More ads than ever, more posts hidden, and people get shadow banned for whatever IG or its users subjectively finds offensive. It is not an open, welcoming platform like it used to be. If someone can make an app similar to the old version of IG, it would be incredibly popular. Huge middle finger to Insta, Facebook, and anyone involved in the degradation of this once cool app.

title: Could IG Develop backup protections for users?
text:
I LOVE Instagram. It is my absolute favorite social media platform. A few weeks ago, my account was accidentally disabled by IG for what appears to be what was a perceived impersonation account. Of course, I was not impersonating myself, but as a global nonprofit advocate and musician, I was devastated by the potential reality that I could lose everything after years of international connections. Thankfully the error was discovered, and my account was restored! 
While it‚Äôs important for entrepreneurs to have their own subscribers, is there a new innovation that IG can develop that would serve as a ‚ÄúCloud‚Äù or ‚ÄúDrive‚Äù that if innocent accounts are permanently disabled, there is some way for them to restore their posts and followers? I know this is a reach, but it astounds me that this isn‚Äôt in place when it‚Äôs so easy for an account to be mistaken as fraudulent or hacked, as IG seeks to combat real fraudulent accounts. & this is happening more and more to accounts where people have worked hard to build their following, helping to bring healthy engagement and traffic to the IG community. Just a question! Thank you!

title: Needs some QoL adjustment
text:
Overall it works well but good lord some of it is annoying. I hate that it‚Äôs becoming so video/reel centric. This isn‚Äôt tiktok and it shouldn‚Äôt try to be. It‚Äôs also not a store or marketplace and it shouldn‚Äôt try to be.

Second, this is a problem that is probably not common, but it is extremely annoying‚ÄîI delete the app from my phone frequently when I have a lot of work to do so that I am not distracted. Despite this app definitely tracking my data and knowing that I have had an account for years now, everytime I redownload it, it will pause any audio or video that is playing to show me every single functionality on the app. Not only this, but some of these tutorials do not go away until you use the feature they are suggesting, which completely interrupts what you were doing. If I check my story, I do not need to be told, in succession, twice each, that I can add it to my highlights or share it as a reel. I do not need to be told, while watching a reel, that there is a home for watching reels on the app and have you interrupt the reel itself. You do not need to remind me how to share posts. The list goes on. It‚Äôs obnoxious.

title: Not Even Giving Me A Chance And My Account Was Deactivated
text:
All I wanted to do was hangout with some friends of mine. They suggested Instagram which I was the only one who didn‚Äôt have it. So I made an account, but I had to wait 24 hours for verification. I couldn‚Äôt do anything like fill in my bio or description. So I waited it out. And by the time the 24 hours passed, I tried to log in, and I was told that my account was deactivated for violating the rules. What are they talking about? I didn‚Äôt do anything wrong. You mean I waited for 24 hours just to be told that my account was deactivated. For violating the guidelines which I didn‚Äôt? I mean what heck Instagram? If you wanted new members into your app, at least let them do something instead of throwing the ban hammer at people who couldn‚Äôt even write anything in their bio.

I wanted this fix so I contacted Instagram via email. Telling them my situation. They told me to do this one task, and which I did. And sent them that task and waited, and waited, and waited. I waited for maybe a month or two. And they didn‚Äôt respond to me. No ‚ÄúThank you‚Äù, no ‚ÄúOkay‚Äù, not even telling me if I did the task right or not. And recently this week I decided to try and contact them via phone. And none of the phone services worked. This is the part where I am very tired of all of this nonsense. And wonder, what is wrong with them?

title: Icons & the black screen to access photos or microphone

I downloaded several times, but there is only a paper airplane at top right on the home page, with the other icons (heart‚ù§Ô∏è and plus sign in a box) are at the bottom. I don‚Äôt see ‚Äúupdates‚Äù in the App Store. Ok-it seems the icons at top update just by going into Settings, even if I don‚Äôt change anything. However, no getting out of some versions of black which is to access photos, or phone as well, as I recall.

Also, I often don‚Äôt get sound in ‚ÄúStories;‚Äù although it sometimes comes in when I press volume buttons up or down and tap screen.

title: Stop trying to be TikTok.
text:
This app, just like everything else Meta touches, is ruined by the insane amount of targeted ads and over the top suggestions. Everything feels like a cheap cash grab when all I want to do is get on and see my friends and acquaintances posts. Instead I get dozens of suggested or sponsored posts for every couple of mutuals posts.
